intro: Coccocypselum monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered coccocypselum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
